newsitem.title: UK: ICI tumbles as Merrill warns of downgrade.
newsitem.headline: ICI tumbles as Merrill warns of downgrade.

text.p: Shares in Imperial Chemical Industries Plc fell sharply on Monday as analysts at Merrill Lynch said they were considering lowering their earnings estimates for the company, market sources said.
The stock was down 44-1/2p or 5.2 percent at 804 by 1019 GMT in active trade of 2.3 million shares.
Analysts at Merrill were not immediately available for comment.
Dealers noted that other industrial companies with a significant proportion of their profits earned overseas also fell sharply, as sterling traded at a five-year high on its trade-weighted index.

British Steel Plc, down 10-3/4p at 147-1/2, was another casualty. The stock went ex-dividend but that accounted for only 7p of the loss. Tomkins Plc fell 8p to 256-1/2 while BTR Plc lost 5p to 196-1/2.
"People have seen that sterling strength and are focusing on those overseas earners again," said one dealer.
